MultiQC.string_process:
process MultiQC {

  publishDir "$params.MultiQCDir", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"
  
  input:
  path("logs/*")

  output:
  path("multiqc_report.html"), emit: multiqc_report
  path("multiqc_data")

  script:
  """
  multiqc .
  """
}

tools_dico.name: MultiQC
tools_dico.description: MultiQC aggregates results from multiple bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report. It searches a given directory for analysis logs and compiles a HTML report. It's a general use tool, perfect for summarising the output from numerous bioinformatics tools.

Sample_FASTQ.string_process:
process Sample_FASTQ {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.testReadsDir", mode: "copy", enabled: "$params.testRun"
  
  when:
  params.testRun

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*_subset_{1,2}.fastq.gz"), emit: test_reads

  script:
  """
  seqtk sample -s 100 ${fastq_reads[0]} 10000 | gzip > ${srrAccession}_subset_1.fastq
  seqtk sample -s 100 ${fastq_reads[1]} 10000 | gzip > ${srrAccession}_subset_2.fastq
  """
}
Sample_FASTQ.string_script:
"""
  seqtk sample -s 100 ${fastq_reads[0]} 10000 | gzip > ${srrAccession}_subset_1.fastq
  seqtk sample -s 100 ${fastq_reads[1]} 10000 | gzip > ${srrAccession}_subset_2.fastq
  """

tools_dico.name: seqtk
tools_dico.description: A tool for processing sequences in the FASTA or FASTQ format. It parses both FASTA and FASTQ files which can also be optionally compressed by gzip.

Raw_FastQC.string_process:
process Raw_FastQC {
  
  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.FastQCDir/raw/", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*fastqc.html"), emit: raw_fastqc_report
                                               

  script:
  """
  fastqc --threads ${task.cpus} ${fastq_reads}
  """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

Trimmed_FastQC.string_process:
process Trimmed_FastQC {
  
  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.FastQCDir/trimmed/", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*fastqc.html"), emit: trimmed_fastqc_report

  script:
  """
  fastqc --threads ${task.cpus} ${fastq_reads}
  """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

Aligned_FastQC.string_process:
process Aligned_FastQC {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.FastQCDir/aligned/", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*fastqc.html"), emit: aligned_fastqc_report

  script:
  """
  fastqc --threads ${task.cpus} ${fastq_reads}
  """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

BAM_Stat.string_process:
process BAM_Stat {
  
  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.RSeQCDir/aligned/$params.alignerMethod", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*.bam_stat.txt"), emit: bam_stat_out

  script:
  """
  bam_stat.py -i ${aligned_bams} > ${aligned_bams}.bam_stat.txt
  """
}

Read_Distribution.string_process:
process Read_Distribution {
  
  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.RSeQCDir/aligned/$params.alignerMethod", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)
  path(annotationBED)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*.read_distribution.txt"), emit: read_distribution_out

  script:
  """
  read_distribution.py \
    -i ${aligned_bams} \
    -r ${annotationBED} \
    > ${aligned_bams}.read_distribution.txt
  """
}

Infer_Experiment.string_process:
process Infer_Experiment {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.RSeQCDir/aligned/$params.alignerMethod", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)
  path(annotationBED)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path( "*.infer_experiment.txt"), emit: infer_experiment_out

  script:
  """
  infer_experiment.py \
    -i ${aligned_bams} \
    -r ${annotationBED} \
    > ${aligned_bams}.infer_experiment.txt
  """
}

Gene_Body_Coverage.string_process:
process Gene_Body_Coverage {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.RSeQCDir/aligned/$params.alignerMethod", mode: "copy"
  label "quality_control"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)
  path(annotationBED)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.gene_body_coverage.txt"), emit: gene_body_coverage

  script:
  """
  geneBody_coverage.py \
    -i ${aligned_bams} \
    -r ${annotationBED} \
    -f png \
    -o ${aligned_bams}.gene
  """
}

Cutadapt.string_process:
process Cutadapt {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.trimmedReadsDir", mode: "copy", pattern: "*.cutadapt.fastq.gz", enabled: "$params.saveTrimmedFastq"
  publishDir "$params.CutadaptDir", mode: "copy", pattern: "*.cutadapt-report.txt"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.cutadapt.fastq.gz"), emit: trimmed_reads
  path("*.cutadapt-report.txt"), emit: cutadapt_report

  script:
  if ( params.adapterLibrary == 'TruSeq' )
                                                                   
                                                                   
  """
  cutadapt \
    -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCA \
    -A AGATCGGAAGAGCGTCGTGTAGGGAAAGAGTGT \
    -m 5 \
    -o ${srrAccession}_1.cutadapt.fastq.gz \
    -p ${srrAccession}_2.cutadapt.fastq.gz \
    --cores ${task.cpus} \
    ${fastq_reads[0]} ${fastq_reads[1]} \
    1> ${srrAccession}.cutadapt-report.txt
  """
}

tools_dico.name: Cutadapt
tools_dico.description: Find and remove adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing reads.

Build_Index.string_process:
process Build_Index {

  tag "${params.alignerMethod}"
  publishDir "$params.genomeDir", mode: "copy"
  label "large_mem"

  input:
  path(genome_fasta)
  path(annotation_gtf)
  val(alignerMethod)

  output:
  path(star_index), emit: index

  script:
  if(alignerMethod == "STAR")
  """
  mkdir -p star_index
   STAR --runMode genomeGenerate \
    --genomeDir star_index \
    --genomeFastaFiles ${genome_fasta} \
    --sjdbGTFfile  ${annotation_gtf} \
    --runThreadN ${task.cpus}
  """
}
Build_Index.string_script:
if(alignerMethod == "STAR")
  """
  mkdir -p star_index
   STAR --runMode genomeGenerate \
    --genomeDir star_index \
    --genomeFastaFiles ${genome_fasta} \
    --sjdbGTFfile  ${annotation_gtf} \
    --runThreadN ${task.cpus}
  """

Load_Index.string_process:
process Load_Index {

                                                                             
                                                                        
                                                                         

  tag "${alignerMethod}"
  label "large_mem"

  input:
  val(alignerMethod)
  path(index)
  
  output:
  val(true), emit: genome_loaded

  script:
  if(alignerMethod == "STAR")
  """
  STAR \
    --runMode alignReads \
    --genomeDir ${index} \
    --genomeLoad LoadAndExit
  """
}

Align_Reads.string_process:
process Align_Reads {

                                                                              
                                                                            
                                                                      

  tag "${alignerMethod}_${srrAccession}"
  publishDir "$params.bamsDir", mode: "copy", pattern: "*.[bs]am", enabled: "$params.saveBAMs"
  publishDir "$params.resultsDir/$params.alignerMethod/logs", mode: "copy", pattern: "*.out"
  publishDir "$params.resultsDir/$params.alignerMethod/quants", mode: "copy", pattern: "*.tab", enabled: "$params.saveQuants"
  label "large_mem"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)
  val(alignerMethod)
  path(index)
  
  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*Aligned.out.bam"), emit: aligned_bams
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*toTranscriptome.out.bam"), emit: transcriptome_bams
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.out"), emit: aligner_outs
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.tab"), emit: quants
  val(true), emit: unload_genome

  script:
  if (alignerMethod == "STAR")
  """
  STAR \
    --genomeDir ${index} \
    --runMode alignReads \
    --readFilesIn ${fastq_reads[0]} ${fastq_reads[1]} \
    --readFilesCommand zcat \
    --runThreadN ${task.cpus} \
    --outFileNamePrefix ${srrAccession}_ \
    --outSAMtype BAM Unsorted \
    --quantMode TranscriptomeSAM GeneCounts
  """
}
Align_Reads.string_script:
if (alignerMethod == "STAR")
  """
  STAR \
    --genomeDir ${index} \
    --runMode alignReads \
    --readFilesIn ${fastq_reads[0]} ${fastq_reads[1]} \
    --readFilesCommand zcat \
    --runThreadN ${task.cpus} \
    --outFileNamePrefix ${srrAccession}_ \
    --outSAMtype BAM Unsorted \
    --quantMode TranscriptomeSAM GeneCounts
  """

Unload_Index.string_process:
process Unload_Index {

                                          

  tag "${alignerMethod}"
  label "large_mem"

  input:
  val(alignerMethod)
  path(index)
  val(unload_genome)
  
  output:
  val(true), emit: load_genome

  script:
  if(alignerMethod == "STAR" & unload_genome)
  """
  STAR \
    --runMode alignReads \
    --genomeDir ${index} \
    --genomeLoad Remove
  """
}

Gtf2Bed.string_process:
process Gtf2Bed {

  tag "$params.annotationGTF"
  publishDir "${params.resultsDir}", mode: "copy"

  input:
  path(annotationGTF)
  
  output:
  path("*.bed"), emit: annotationBED

  script:
  """
  bedparse gtf2bed ${annotationGTF} > ${annotationGTF}.bed
  """
}

GZIP_Compress.string_process:
process GZIP_Compress {

  tag "$srrAccession"
  publishDir "$params.rawReadsDir", mode: "copy", enabled: "$params.compressFastq"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(fastq_reads)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.fastq.gz"), emit: gz_raw_reads

  script:
  """
  gzip --stdout ${fastq_reads[0]} > ${srrAccession}_1.fastq.gz
  gzip --stdout ${fastq_reads[1]} > ${srrAccession}_2.fastq.gz
  """

}

Sort_BAMs_Coordinate.string_process:
process Sort_BAMs_Coordinate {

  tag "${alignerMethod}_${srrAccession}"
  publishDir "$params.bamsDir", mode: "copy", enabled: "$params.saveBAMs", pattern: "*.bam"
  label "large_mem"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)
  val(alignerMethod)

  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.bam"), emit: sorted_aligned_bams

  script:
  if (alignerMethod == 'STAR' )
  """
  samtools sort ${aligned_bams} -o ${srrAccession}.Aligned.sortedByCoord.out.bam
  """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

Index_BAMs.string_process:
process Index_BAMs {

  tag "${alignerMethod}_${srrAccession}"
  publishDir "$params.bamsDir", mode: "copy", enabled: "$params.saveBAMs", pattern: "*.bai"

  input:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path(aligned_bams)
  val(alignerMethod)
  
  output:
  tuple val(srrAccession), path("*.bai"), emit: bam_index

  script:
  if (alignerMethod == 'STAR')
  """
  samtools index -b ${aligned_bams} ${aligned_bams}.bai
  """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.
